CDSCanvas.AdvancedContextDesctiption:
Here you have the most control. be careful, the native prompt is completely overwritten. if you want to use the native 'else' connector you need to make sure to instruct your prompt to respond with <NOANS> when it doesn't find a satisfactory answer and always close with {context}.

E.g. You are a consultant ... <NOANS> {context}

InfoMessages.field_name: Give a name to the Form field (ex: name _ User). The name can contain only letters numbers and _
InfoMessages.field_type: Select the type of given that will be inserted in this field (ex: Text).
InfoMessages.field_regex: Insert the personalized regex for control over the inserted data
InfoMessages.field_label: Write a clear label that helps users to enter the correct data (ex: what's your name?)
InfoMessages.field_error: Write an error message if the data entered by the user is not correct

DESCRIPTION.Reply: Pro tip: Turn this block into a programmed proactive message.
DESCRIPTION.RandomReply: Create some replies that will be randomly selected
DESCRIPTION.AgentHandoff:
This action replaces the current chatbot with an agent.
The upcoming agent is assigned to the conversation following the department rules
DESCRIPTION.Close: This action instantly closes the current conversation
DESCRIPTION.IfOperatingHours:
This action moves the flow to different blocks, based on the operating hours status.
During working hours the TRUE block will be triggered.
During offline hours the FALSE block will be triggered.
One of the two options can be unset. The flow will optionally stop only when a block-populated condition is met.
To optionally stop the flow set ‚ÄúStop on met condition‚Äù. To always continue unset the same option.
DESCRIPTION.IfOnlineAgent:
This action moves the flow to different blocks, based on the agents‚Äô availability.
If there are agents available the TRUE block will be triggered.
If there are no agents available the FALSE block will be triggered.
One of the two options can be unset. The flow will optionally stop only when a block-populated condition is met.
To optionally stop the flow set ‚ÄúStop on met condition‚Äù. To always continue unset Stop on met condition.
DESCRIPTION.ConnectBlock:
This action moves the flow to the specified block.
Keep in mind that if there are other actions in the current block actions-pipeline they will be executed too, generating a parallel-execution of all the branches affering to each block triggered through this Connect-block action.
DESCRIPTION.ReplaceBot: Choose a chatbot to replace the current one in the conversation
DESCRIPTION.Wait: This action waits the specified amount of milliseconds before moving to the next one along the block actions-pipeline
DESCRIPTION.SendEmail:
This action send an email to the specified users group or email addresses.
You can use a comma sepatated addresses list.
i.e. 'support@domanin.com, info@domain.com'
You can use the special tag '@everyone' to send an email to each of the {{BRAND_NAME}}‚Äôs project teamates.

You can also use the name of a single user group using the group name. i.e. 'sales'
DESCRIPTION.WhatsAppStatic: This action send an approved WhatsApp template
DESCRIPTION.WhatsAppByAttribute: This action send an approved WhatsApp template
DESCRIPTION.WhatsAppBySegment: This action send an approved WhatsApp template
DESCRIPTION.AskTheKnowledgeBase: This action forwards the question to ChatGPT
DESCRIPTION.GPTTask: This action forwards the question to ChatGPT
DESCRIPTION.GPTAssistant: The Assistants API is designed to help developers build powerful AI assistants capable of performing a variety of tasks.
DESCRIPTION.CaptureUserReply: This action allow to capture the user reply
DESCRIPTION.Qapla: This action allow to connect with Qapla'

last_user_text.description: The last text the user typed. This is overwritten on each user reply

user_country.description: The user Country as decoded by {{BRAND_NAME}}

user_city.description: The user City as decoded by {{BRAND_NAME}}

user_language.description: The user language decoded on channel

transcript.description: All the conversation messages exchanged with this chatbot during the chat

department_id.description: The ID of the department where this chatbot is activated

department_name.description: 'The name of the department where this chatbot is activated

project_id.description: The name of the project where this chatbot belongs to

last_message_id.description: The unique ID of the last message sent

user_id.description: The user unique ID inside {{BRAND_NAME}} database

user_agent.description: The web user agent where this conversation initiated

chatChannel.description: The channel where this conversation belongs to. Ex. 'web', 'whatsapp', 'facebook', 'telegram'

user_source_page.description: The page where this conversations is runinng. Only available on channel 'web'

chat_url.description: The url of the Chat to send to a colleague to chat with this user. Use 'Invite human' action to invite the human to this chat

user_ip_address.description: The user IP address, when available

lastUserDocumentAsAttachmentURL.description: Useful if you want to have an URL of the uploaded document that can be displayed in chat and you will always download on click

lastUserDocumentAsInlineURL.description: Document as 'view inline' on click. Useful if you want to use this link in a WebRequest or externar API invocation to get the document content

lastUserDocumentName.description: The name of the document uploaded by the user. It's empy if no document is uploaded

lastUserDocumentType.description: The type of the document uploaded by the user. It's empy if no document is uploaded

lastUserImageURL.description: The public URL to access the image uploaded by the user. It's empy if no image is uploaded

lastUserImageName.description: The name of the image uploaded by the user. It's empy if no image is uploaded

lastUserImageType.description: The type of the image uploaded by the user. It's empy if no image is uploaded

lastUserImageWidth.description: The height in pixel of the image uploaded by the user. It's empy if no image is uploaded

lastUserImageHeight.description: The wdth in pixel of the image uploaded by the user. It's empy if no image is uploaded

userLeadId.description: The user contact Id in {{BRAND_NAME}} Contacts

userCompany.description: The user Company name in {{BRAND_NAME}} Contacts

currentPhoneNumber.description: The user phone used in the current conversation (i.e. coming from Whatsapp / SMS channels)

decodedCustomJWT.description: When the end-user (lead) is strong authenticated this JSON object contains certified info from the authentication provider. To get certified email use {{decodedCustomJWT.email}}. In the same way you can get firstname {{decodedCustomJWT.firstname}}, lastname {{decodedCustomJWT.laastname}} or custom attributes, i.e. {{decodedCustomJWT.attributes.SSN}}

strongAuthenticated.description: Indicates that the current user logged in the chat session with 'strong authentication'

voiceLanguage.description: Define the main language for the voice system interpreter

voiceName.description: Define the name of the voice chatbot

event.description: Every handled event during current call flow

lastBlock.description: The last triggered block heard by the caller

ThereWasSomeTroubleConnectingToNetwork: Our apologies. There was some trouble connecting to network

CDSGlobals.NoGlobalVariables:
No global variables

Global variables are a set of variables that are always available in your flows
CDSGlobals.InfoTitle: Use variables to reuse values and protect sensitive data
CDSGlobals.InfoDescription:
Store sensitive data in variables type secret to keep its values masked on the screen.
Work with the current value of a variable to prevent sharing sensitive values with your team
